data.title: Windows shell integration system settings
Fail to uninstall packages
data.body:
First try the GIU system to uninstall the package,it fail,then second using the CLI,enter `apm uninstall PACKAGE`,the come with a error message said `Failed to delete PACKAGE: Does not exist`

Atom infos:
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

data.title: Open Project, Files Atom suddenly closed.....
data.body:
I am using latest version of atom 1.8.0

when I open any file or project by shortcut key {crtl+o} for open file, {ctrl+shift+o} for open folder or {ctrl+alt+o} for add project.....

then my atom get closed.

Like (Same as) I press crtl+shift+w which is for close atom window

Please mail me if there is any solution for it.....

Thanks in advance. :)

data.title: node-gyp rebuild fails on OS X
data.body:
When cloning a fresh fork of the atom repo, I run `npm install` and get the log below. I get similar errors when running `script/build`.

I'm running Node v6.3.0, but I've also tried v5, v4, and v0.12.

```
npm WARN deprecated minimatch@2.0.10: Please update to minimatch 3.0.2 or higher to avoid a RegExp DoS issue
npm WARN deprecated graceful-fs@2.0.3: graceful-fs v3.0.0 and before will fail on node releases >= v7.0. Please update to graceful-fs@^4.0.0 as soon as possible. Use 'npm ls graceful-fs' to find it in the tree.

npm WARN deprecated jade@0.26.3: Jade has been renamed to pug, please install the latest version of pug instead of jade
npm WARN prefer global typescript@1.4.1 should be installed with -g
npm WARN prefer global jasmine-node@1.10.2 should be installed with -g

> oniguruma@5.1.2 install /Users/username/Development/atom/atom/node_modules/oniguruma
> node-gyp rebuild

  CC(target) Release/obj.target/oniguruma/deps/onig/regcomp.o
make: -DNODE_GYP_MODULE_NAME=oniguruma: No such file or directory

gyp ERR! build error 
gyp ERR! stack Error: `make` failed with exit code: 2
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.onExit (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/lib/build.js:276:23)
gyp ERR! stack     at emitTwo (events.js:106:13)
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:191:7)
gyp ERR! stack     at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:204:12)
gyp ERR! System Darwin 15.5.0

gyp ERR! node -v v6.3.0

[listed packages here]

npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the oniguruma@5.1.2 install script 'node-gyp rebuild'.
npm ERR! Make sure you have the latest version of node.js and npm installed.
npm ERR! If you do, this is most likely a problem with the oniguruma package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
```

data.body: See discussion in atom#7159

data.title: Build script error for i386
data.body:
platform: Debian i386.
error: while running script/build, the script bombs due to looking for x87 instead of x86 at nodejs.org

the build script is looking for:

http://nodejs.org/dist/v0.10.40/node-v0.10.40-linux-x87.tar.gz

when it should be looking for:

http://nodejs.org/dist/v0.10.40/node-v0.10.40-linux-x86.tar.gz

data.title: Unicode Encoding Issue with Python 2.7 Atom 1.8.0
data.body:
Running on Mac os X 10.11
Atom ver 1.8.0
The encoding comment is not working in files created by atom:

```
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*- 
print u'好'
```

It simply didn't recognise the encoding scheme declared and the python interpreter used ASCII by default.

The same content works when editing the file with nano.
Same issue found on another Mac
In atom:
`print u'好'.encode('utf-8')`worked well.

But the comment declaration method is quite important for python, please pay attention and fix.

data.title: Tabs / Spaces are really annoying
data.body:
After opening existing HTML with atom, i fixed all the tabs in Notepad++ with a 4 space tab, i set a 4 space tab in Atom, then opened the file, and alot of this stuff has an extra space, missing a space, as you can see

http://prntscr.com/bpxfqn

Now, i went and changed the ones in the red box to show, they were originally missing 2 spaces, (half a tab) it doesn't break any code, but keeps messing up every time i fix it, and reopen it, they seem to break again

data.body:
i also have this problem:#11869,#471,#661

os:win7
version:1.8.0

the project folder disappear when atom is closed, and i open a new file with context menu.

data.title: Atom crashes on open preferences.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom crashes on open preferences.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Start Atom.
2. Edit -> Preferences.
### Versions

$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

$ apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1

$ uname -a
Linux SEPHIROTH 3.13.0-91-generic #138-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jun 24 17:00:34 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

data.title: Using Atom as git editor on Windows 10 is broken
data.body:
### Description

I've set Atom to be my git editor using the following command from the [GitHub docs](https://help.github.com/articles/associating-text-editors-with-git/):

```
git config --global core.editor "atom --wait"
```

When I run an interactive git command, Atom doesn't open the text file and and error is displayed on the console.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Set Atom as your git editor: `git config --global core.editor "atom --wait"`
2. Run a git command which needs input: `git rebase branch -i`

**Expected behavior:** Atom opens with the git rebase text file.

**Actual behavior:** It fails with this error message:

```
'ebase-merge' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
```
### Versions

Atom versions:

```
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```
- Windows 10 Enterprise 64bit, build 10240.
- git version 2.9.0.windows.1.

data.title: Editor Freeze when working in Markdown
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

The only thing I could find was https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11503 which was closed as fixed by the author.

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When editing a certain link markup, the editor freezes for a few seconds
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Make a MD file with `[[http://www.wowace.com/addons/weakauras/pages/display-types/#w-default-position-options|Default Position Options]]`
2. Select `Default Position Options]` and cut it
3. Paste that in the front of the string and remove the extra `[`
4. Remove the extra `]` at the end and the pipe

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

no freeze

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

editor freezes for a few seconds
### Versions

1.9.0.beta0
You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

Video: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/26me77ovvqbwl2v/2016-07-05_18-53-52.webm?dl=0

data.title: Ambiguity between default and overridden values in the config
data.body:
### Description

There is an ambiguity in the config between default and overridden values. Sometimes you want to set a value which might be equal to the "original" default value. However, atom detects that and removes it automatically, causing the actual default value (in "*") to be used.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Set default ("*") tab length to 4
2. Try to set other language's tab length to 2

Since 2 is the default value, it's automatically removed and causes the "*" default of 4 to be used.

Before save:

``` coffee
"*":
  editor:
    tabLength: 4
".coffee.source":
  editor:
    tabLength: 2
".c.source":
  editor:
    tabLength: 2
".cpp.source":
  editor:
    tabLength: 2
".go.source":
  editor:
    tabLength: 2
".python.source":
  editor:
    tabLength: 2
```

After save:

``` coffee
"*":
  editor:
    tabLength: 4
".c.source":
  editor:
    tabLength: 4
".coffee.source":
  editor:
    tabLength: 4
".cpp.source":
  editor:
    tabLength: 4
".go.source":
  editor:
    tabLength: 4
".python.source":
  editor:
    tabLength: 2

```

Note: this is not a mistake, Python actually does preserve the desired value of 2. Why? Because its default value is 4, not 2.
### Versions

Tested with Atom 1.8.0, using a completely clean, freshly created .atom directory in Windows 10 64bit.

data.title: Unable to select text or move cursor with keyboard shortcuts CMD+Arrow/CMD+Shift+Arrow using keyboard
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Unable to select entire field / unable to move cursor to start and end of field using keyboard shortcuts native to mac when in Save dialog
### Steps to Reproduce
1. open file
2. open save dialog window.  
3. in the file name text field attempt to move the cursor using the keyboard from start of field or end or vice versa (CMD+Arrow Left or CMD+Arrow Right)
4. Additionally select CMD+Shift+Arrow left or Arrow right to select full field and does not work

data.title: Fail creat shortcut icon in Desktop and in Start menu Windows 10 32 bit
data.body: When I setup atom 1.8.0, Windows 10 64bit created an shortcut but Windows 32bit didn't .

data.title: open an image many times
data.body:
double click an image,open 1 times.
single click an image,preview 
then double click the image, will open the image in a new window.

data.title: Cannot build atom on Win10, error: node.exe: bad option: --harmony_collections
data.body:
I tried to compile atom on Windows 10 x64.
And I have got python 2.7.10(x86), node 4.4.5(x64) installed already.
But when I execute `script\build` command, I got this:

```
D:\Dev\GitHub\atom>script\build
Node: v4.4.5
npm: v2.13.3
Python: v2.7.10
Installing build modules...
=> Took 4582ms.

Installing apm...
=> Took 1535ms.

Deleting old packages...
node.exe: bad option: --harmony_collections

D:\Dev\GitHub\atom>node --version
v4.4.5

D:\Dev\GitHub\atom>npm --version
2.15.5

D:\Dev\GitHub\atom>apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.5.3.windows.1
visual studio
```

I tried search on existed issues and on google, but still not find any solution.
Here is the screenshot:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1808990/16573281/a8ea80ae-42a4-11e6-9c47-3a1afc76c489.png)
I got confused and have no idea on what to do next.
Can anybody help me get out of this problem please?

data.title: Tweak / Change ctrl-backspace behaviour - delete to word boundary
data.body:
This addresses the unexpected `ctrl+backspace` behaviour: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3362

Changes the default `ctrl + backspace/del` (`alt + backspace/del` on osx) behaviour from deleting to the end of word to deleting to the word boundaries.
This makes atom behave similar to all other editors and fixes an issue that has been bothering a lot of people for a while (check the link above)

data.title: Atom: 1.8.0:.DS_store file is visible after adding ignored names
data.body: ### Description The version I have: under tree-view setting, doesn't have hide ignored names. ### Version: 1.8.0 Mac

data.title: cmd+d is working in a wrong way...
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

cmd+d to select the next word is working in a wrong way, I think...
### Steps to Reproduce
1. if we have a method like this: 

```
abc_aaa.abc_aaa.aaa();
```
1. select the first **aaa**  it looks like this:
   
   abc_[aaa]().abc_aaa.aaa();
2. then **cmd + d** it looks like this:
   
   abc_[aaa.abc_]()aaa.aaa();

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

 but I want this way: 

 abc_[aaa]().abc_[aaa]().aaa();

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
### Versions

> Atom    : 1.8.0
> Electron: 0.36.8
> Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
> Node    : 5.1.1

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: update nodejs installation instructions link for Fedora/CentOS/RHEL
data.body:
In the nodejs installation instructions for Fedora/Centos/RHEL, the old [link](https://github.com/nodejs/node-v0.x-archive/wiki/Installing-Node.js-via-package-manager#enterprise-linux-and-fedora) redirects the user to another [link](https://github.com/nodejs/node/wiki) which is the nodejs wiki, and where there are no installation instructions.
The correct link should be [https://nodejs.org/en/download/package-manager/#enterprise-linux-and-fedora](https://nodejs.org/en/download/package-manager/#enterprise-linux-and-fedora), which contains the most recent instructions to install nodejs.

data.title: Atom Crashes After Opening Project Folder with 21k Line js File
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom crashes with an "Editor not responding" message when loading a /dist/main.js file in a React.js project. If you're familiar with the React.js framework, main.js is a JavaScript file generated by tools like gulp, browserify and reactify to merge all libraries into one JavaScript file in order to be browser friendly. It is important to note that in this instance, the resulting file is approximately 21,000 lines of code.

Process information from top. Over 100% cpu being consumed by Atom Helper

```
53222  Atom Helper  101.0 01:31.25 21/1  0    124   250M   0B     0B     52624 52624 running  *0[2]            0.00000 0.00000    501  135808    1575
```

Problem is reproducible 100% of the time and occurs in safe mode.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Launch Atom
2. File -> Add Project Folder -> Add folder with 21k line (1.8MB) main.js file

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
CPU usage remains stable. Ability to edit and scroll through files as large or larger than 21k of code with given hardware (see versions).

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
A few seconds to a minute after adding the project folder containing a 21k line main.js file CPU usage from an Atom helper process exceeds 100%. Error message "Editor not responding" occurs.
### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.4
Mac OS X: 10.11.4
MacBookPro Retina 15-Inch
2.5 GHz Intel Core i7 (4 Core)
16GB RAM
nVidia GPU
```
